definition: a thousand tries leads to one success (idiom, humble expr.); Even without any notable ability on my part, I may still get it right sometimes by good luck.
see 鞦韆|秋千[qiu1 qian1]
thousand
to think over/to consider/anxiety
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
reflect a thousand times and you can still make a mistake (idiom); to err is human
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
a cut above/top quality
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
partial view/limited outlook
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
Chinese set expression, typically of 4 characters, often alluding to a story or historical quotation/idiom/proverb/saying/adage/CL:條|条[tiao2],本[ben3],句[ju4]
Sima Xiangru is meticulous and Mei Gao is fast (idiom)/to each his good points
to pluck a pearl from the black dragon (idiom, from Zhuangzi); fig. to pick out the salient points (from a tangled situation)/to see through to the nub
Words of benevolence apply universally (idiom). Humanitarian expressions benefit all.
to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
great despite minor blemishes/a rough diamond
one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/short attention span
person narrow-minded and shortsighted
to kill a pig as a lesson to the children (idiom); parents must teach by example
established and irrefutable (idiom)
